Description: The FHIR DocumentReference.Search (Radiology Results) resource returns documentation related to a specific radiology result, including who entered the result and when. It includes details about the patient associated with the result, as well as a reference to the Binary resource that contains the documentation content associated with the result.

author.Name: author
author.Description: FHIR ID for the providers who signed or addended the study.

class.Name: class
class.Description: Must be set to “imaging-result” if specified.
class.Optional: Optional starting in Epic version February 2022 or in Epic version November 2021 with special updates. Either “class” or “type” must be specified in earlier versions of Epic.

indexed.Name: indexed
indexed.Description: The instant or range of instants when a study was addended or finalized.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: FHIR Patient ID. If provided, the search returns all matching results for this patient.
patient.Optional: FHIR Patient ID. If provided, the search returns all matching results for this patient.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The instant when the exam was performed.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: FHIR Patient ID. If provided, the search returns all matching results for this patient.
subject.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must match.

type.Name: type
type.Description: LOINC code for the radiology result.
type.Optional: Optional starting in Epic version February 2022 or in Epic version November 2021 with special updates. Either “class” or “type” must be specified in earlier versions of Epic.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: A single entry in the resource bundle.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A single resource returned as part of this bundle.

DocumentReference.Name: DocumentReference
DocumentReference.Description: An instance of the STU3 DocumentReference resource.

authenticator.Name: authenticator
authenticator.Description: The user who signed the study. Reference to the Practitioner resource. Returns only the first user who signed the study.

author.Name: author
author.Description: The user who finalized the study and users who addended the study. Reference to the Practitioner resource.

url.Name: url
url.Description: Link to the Binary resource for text content.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: Encounter that order is linked to. Reference to the Encounter resource. Returns only the first encounter linked to the results.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The instant when the exam was ended.

created.Name: created
created.Description: The instant when the exam was finalized.

docStatus.Name: docStatus
docStatus.Description: If the study is addended, returns "amended". Otherwise, returns "final".

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: The order identifier from the Epic system. Returns the same information as masterIdentifier.

indexed.Name: indexed
indexed.Description: The instant when the study was finalized. If the study was addended, returns the instant when the last addendum was finalized.

masterIdentifier.Name: masterIdentifier
masterIdentifier.Description: The order identifier from the Epic system. Returns the same information as identifier.

profile.Name: profile
profile.Description: Available in Netherlands environments only. This environment shows that this API conforms to the profile connected to the following canonical url: http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/IHE.MHD.Minimal.DocumentReference

status.Name: status
status.Description: The status of the result. Always "current".

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient record that is linked to the order. Reference to the Patient resource.

type.Name: type
type.Description: Returns the LOINC code for the order or the procedure.
